place.name: BENNIWORTH
place.gazetteerText: BENNIWORTH, a parish in Horncastle district, Lincoln; on the Wolds, 5½ miles ENE of Wragby, and 8½ E of Wickenby r. station. Post Town, Donington, under Louth. Acres, 2,994. Real property, £4,224. Pop., 431. Houses, 83. The property is divided among a few. A British urn was found. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £506.* Patron, G. F. Heneage, Esq. The church has a Norman porch, and is good. There is a Wesleyan chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
